text: The 2017 División Profesional season (officially the 2017 Copa TIGO-Visión Banco for sponsorship reasons) was the 83rd season of top-flight professional football in Paraguay. ==Teams== ===Stadia and locations=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Team ! Manager ! Home city ! Stadium ! | Celso Ayala |6 November |- |General Díaz | Mario Jara |6 December |4th | | |} ==Torneo Apertura== The Campeonato de Apertura, also the Copa TIGO-Visión Banco for sponsorship reasons, was the 115th official championship of the Primera División, called "Mario Agustín Sapriza Nunes", and the first championship of the 2017 season. It began on February 3 and ended on June 24. ===Standings=== http://www.espnfc.us/primera- division-de-paraguay/1892/table ===Results=== ===Top goalscorers=== {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Club ! Goals |- | align=center | 1 | Santiago Salcedo |Libertad |align=center| 15 |- | align=center | 2 | Alfio Oviedo |Independiente CG |align=center| 11 |- | align=center | 3 | Néstor Camacho |Guaraní |align=center| 10 |- | align=center | 4 | Brian Montenegro |Olimpia |align=center| 8 |- | rowspan=4 align=center | 5 | Guido Di Vanni |Sportivo Luqueño |align=center| 7 |- | Nicolás Martínez |Sportivo Trinidense |align=center| 7 |- | Jesús Medina |Libertad |align=center| 7 |- | Jorge Ortega |Rubio Ñu |align=center| 7 |} Source: Soccerway ==Torneo Clausura== The Campeonato de Clausura, also the Copa TIGO-Visión Banco for sponsorship reasons, was the 116th official championship of the Primera División, called "Centenario del Club General Díaz - Dr. Hassel Aguilar Sosa", and the second championship of the 2017 season. It began on July 21 and ended on December 10. ===Standings=== ===Results=== ===Top goalscorers=== {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! Rank ! Name ! Club ! Goals |- | rowspan=2 align=center | 1 | Rodrigo Bogarín |Guaraní |align=center| 11 |- | Diego Churín |Cerro Porteño |align=center| 11 |- | rowspan=2 align=center | 3 | Blas Díaz |General Díaz |align=center| 9 |- | Walter González |Olimpia |align=center| 9 |- | rowspan=4 align=center | 5 | Gerardo Arévalos |Sportivo Luqueño |align=center| 8 |- | Néstor Camacho |Olimpia |align=center| 8 |- | Alfio Oviedo |Cerro Porteño |align=center| 8 |- | Javier Toledo |Sol de América |align=center| 8 |- | align=center | 9 | Juan Manuel Salgueiro |Nacional |align=center| 7 |- | rowspan=4 align=center | 10 | Antonio Bareiro |Libertad |align=center| 6 |- | Junior Marabel |Deportivo Capiatá |align=center| 6 |- | Óscar Ruiz |Cerro Porteño |align=center| 6 |- | Pablo Zeballos |Sol de América |align=center| 6 |} Source: Soccerway ==Aggregate table== ==Relegation== Relegation is determined at the end of the season by computing an average of the number of points earned per game over the past three seasons. The two teams with the lowest average were relegated to the División Intermedia for the following season. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !width=28| Pos !!width=185| Team !!width=50| 2015 Pts !!width=50| 2016 Pts !!width=50| 2017 Pts !!width=50| Total Pts !!width=50| Total Pld !!width=50| Avg !! Relegation |- | 1 ||align="left"| Guaraní | 86 || 83 || 85 || 254 || 132 || '''''' |- | 2 ||align="left"| Olimpia | 79 || 90 || 78 || 247 || 132 || '''''' |- | 3 ||align="left"| Cerro Porteño | 96 || 66 || 80 || 242 || 132 || '''''' |- | 4 ||align="left"| Libertad | 76 || 83 || 75 || 234 || 132 || '''''' |- | 5 ||align="left"| Sol de América | 57 || 63 || 62 || 182 || 132 || '''''' |- | 6 ||align="left"|Deportivo Capiatá | 54 || 67 || 50 || 171 || 132 || '''''' |- | 7 ||align="left"| Sportivo Luqueño | 57 || 53 || 50 || 160 || 132 || '''''' |- | 8 ||align="left"| General Díaz | 45 || 46 || 60 || 151 || 132 || '''''' |- | 9 ||align="left"| Nacional | 43 || 54 || 50 || 147 || 132 || '''''' |-bgcolor=#FFCCCC | 10 ||align="left"| Independiente CG (O) | — || — || 47 || 47 || 44 || '''''' |rowspan=2| Qualification to Relegation playoff decider |-bgcolor=#FFCCCC | 11 ||align="left"| Rubio Ñu (R) | 48 || 48 || 45 || 141 || 132 || '''''' |-bgcolor=#FF8888 | 12 ||align="left"| Sportivo Trinidense (R) | — || — || 34 || 34 || 44 || '''''' | Relegation to División Intermedia |} Source: APF ===Relegation playoff decider=== Since Independiente CG and Rubio Ñu ended with the same average, a match on neutral ground between both teams was played to determine the second relegated team. The loser was relegated to the División Intermedia. ==See also== *2017 in Paraguayan football ==References== ==External links== *APF's official website Paraguay 1 Category:Paraguayan Primera División seasons
title: 2017 Paraguayan Primera División season
